google_play_reviews.content: Not usable for me, because my Samsung system is supporting gestures I am not able to open the menu without leaving the app while doing it. So I am not able to configure the URL. Sad, because I really wanted to use the app. Maybe add some link in the URL search to open the settings from there?
Nice viewer for openHAB on mobile and tablet

Great app. There does seem to be a bug though, at least on my device (Lenovo tb_7305f), after a few days of display, it stops updating the screen and then when I restart it, it says that the app is not responding. Is there any way to debug this? I need it to be reliable! Thanks to the devs
As described. Works perfectly so far. Now my tablet is always on habpanel. Great work!

Awful app. This app completely hijacked my phone and would not let me back to my homescreen. It kept going back to the Welcome to Openhab 2 page. I had to put my phone into safemode and then delete the app just to use my phone again!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: If you set the app as launcher, then it starts with the system every time. This is what is expected. Swipe down from the top to show the notification bar, access the settings from there and set another app as launcher.

google_play_reviews.content: I tried option with HV acceleration and now it's working fine. As for now, everything is ok.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Did you try to enable HW acceleration in the settings? Does that make a difference?

google_play_reviews.content: Great app . I constantly get requested for a username and password every time i open this using openhab cloud. The openhab hab does not do this. Only this app. Highly annoying  EDIT: Cant wait for the next version! Thats great news!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app was never intended to be used with openHAB cloud, but the next version will allow to store all website credentials across app restarts.

google_play_reviews.content: It works, just a minor issue because of the external images which do not work.  They do in Chrome, they do not in the HABPanelViewer.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: External images should work as long as the same protocol is used. Google's webview component prohibits loading of external http content in https pages. Maybe that is your problem? If not, feel free to open an issue at https://github.com/vbier/habpanelviewer/issues
